title: Air Canada to Resume Flights Amid Ongoing Strike, 100K+ Passengers Stranded
snippets: Air Canada said it will gradually restart operations after reaching a deal with the flight attendants' union to end a strike that disrupted the travel plans of hundreds of thousands of travelers.

Strike over wages and ground work has cancelled travel for 500,000 people worldwide

Air Canada flight attendants say they have reached a “tentative” deal with the airline to end a strike over wages and ground work that has cancelled travel for half a million people worldwide.

Roughly

Arbitrator orders 10,000 striking staff back to work after government intervenes – unconstitutionally, union says

Union leaders representing 10,000 striking flight attendants have said they would be willing to go to jail rather than comply with an order to return to work, as
Air Canada flights will resume Tuesday evening, it said. Details were sparse on the tentative deal between the company and its flight attendants union, CUPE.
Thousands of flight attendants must still approve the agreement. The walkout, which began Saturday, has disrupted half a million travelers’ plans, the airline said.
Negotiations between the airline and the flight attendants’ union resumed on Monday, hours after a labor relations board declared the walkout illegal.
The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will continue for at least a second day. Air Canada said it had suspended its reopening plan until Monday evening.
Air Canada says service will gradually resume following an agreement being reached with flight attendants, but advised some cancellations will still occur.
Flight attendants at American Airlines partner PSA demonstrated Monday. They seek boarding pay and wage gains, just as Air Canada flight attendants did during a strike.

The union representing Air Canada’s 10,000 flight attendants says its members will return to work after reaching a tentative agreement with the airline, effectively ending a disruptive strike that grounded thousands of flights and stranded passengers across the country. The Air Canada Componen
titles: Air Canada says flights will resume Tuesday night after flight attendants strike ends
Air Canada flight attendants reach ‘tentative’ deal with airline to end strike
Flight attendant union leaders ‘ready to go to jail’ as Air Canada strike outlawed
Air Canada to resume flights after making deal to end cabin crew strike
Air Canada and Striking Flight Attendants’ Union Reach Tentative Deal
Talks Restart as Air Canada Flight Attendants’ Strike Continues
Air Canada Flight Attendants Say They Will Defy Back-to-Work Order
Air Canada, flight attendants reach tentative deal ending strike
Flight Attendants Get Deal At Air Canada And Talk At American Partner
Strike over: Air Canada flight attendants, airline reach tentative agreement
summary: Air Canada announced plans to resume flights on Monday evening after a strike by flight attendants, represented by CUPE, led to widespread cancellations, affecting around 130,000 passengers daily. The union has defied a federal back-to-work order, challenging its legality and continuing strikes for better wages, causing significant travel disruptions. This defiance comes despite Air Canada’s attempt to restart operations, leaving over 100,000 people stranded. The situation remains unresolved as the union and Air Canada navigate the ongoing dispute.

title: Colts Name Daniel Jones as Week 1 Starting QB, Benching Richardson
snippets: The Colts have named Daniel Jones as their Week 1 starting QB, opting for the veteran over Anthony Richardson Sr.
Jones has gotten another chance to be a QB1
With Daniel Jones named the Colts' starting quarterback, what does this mean for Anthony Richardson?
The Colts have reportedly named Daniel Jones the team’s Week 1 starting quarterback, moving away from former fourth-overall pick Anthony Richardson, ESPN’s Adam Schefter reported Tuesday.
titles: Colts name Jones as Week 1 QB over Richardson
Daniel Jones wins Colts' starting QB job: Former Giants first-rounder beats out Anthony Richardson
Daniel Jones named Colts' starting QB; what's next for Anthony Richardson?
Report: Daniel Jones named Colts’ Week 1 starter over Anthony Richardson
summary: The Indianapolis Colts have officially named Daniel Jones as their starting quarterback for Week 1, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter. This decision indicates the team is choosing Jones's experience over Anthony Richardson, the former fourth-overall pick. This move gives Jones another opportunity to lead a team as QB1, while it raises questions about Richardson's role with the Colts moving forward.

title: European Leaders Present Ukraine Security Plan in DC, Trump Noncommittal
snippets: Trump, who has ruled out NATO security for Ukraine, sees US role in Kyiv's security along with Europe
After the EU-US summit on Russia's war against Ukraine, a debate is underway in Germany about security guarantees and what role Germany should play going forward.

A repeated refrain from European leaders during remarks ahead of their meeting was the need for security guarantees for Ukraine.

As western leaders meet, questions remain about the steps they could take to prevent any future Russian aggression

  • Russia-Ukraine war – latest news upda
President Trump has not committed to adding American forces to the mix in Ukraine. No one has detailed publicly what form defenses would take, but there are several options.

summary: European leaders met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington, DC, emphasizing the need for security guarantees for Ukraine. A document outlining Kyiv's proposals was presented to the US President at a significant White House meeting. However, President Trump has not committed to deploying American forces in Ukraine, and the specifics of the proposed defenses remain undisclosed.

title: UK Withdraws Request for Apple Data Access After US Talks
snippets: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard says change upholds privacy of US users.
Intelligence Director Tulsi Gabbard said the British government’s order “would have enabled access to the protected encrypted data of American citizens.”

Tulsi Gabbbard says Home Office no longer demanding ‘backdoor’ to encrypted material

The UK government has dropped its insistence that Apple allows law enforcement officials “backdoor” access to US customer data, Donald Trump’s spy chief, Tulsi Gabbard, says.

The US director of nation
Tulsi Gabbard said that President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance also participated in the negotiations with the U.K. government over its once-secret demand to Apple.
titles: UK agrees to drop mandate for Apple ‘back door’, US spy chief says
U.K. drops ‘back door’ demand for Apple user data, U.S. intel chief says
UK has backed down on demand to access US Apple user data, spy chief says
US spy chief says UK has dropped its Apple backdoor demand
summary: The UK government has withdrawn its request for Apple to provide "backdoor" access to encrypted data of US users, according to Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard. This decision, which Gabbard says upholds the privacy of US citizens, came after negotiations involving President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance. The initial demand by the UK's Home Office was aimed at allowing law enforcement access to encrypted material, a move now reversed in favor of user privacy.

title: Pacers Extend Coach Carlisle's Contract After NBA Finals Run
snippets: The Indiana Pacers and head coach Rick Carlisle have agreed to a multiyear contract extension, sources confirmed to ESPN.
Carlisle has guided the Pacers to the last two Eastern Conference Finals

The Indiana Pacers have agreed to a multi-year extension with Carlisle, NBA insider Marc Stein reported Tuesday, prolonging his stay in the Midwest after helping the team to its second NBA Finals in franchise history.
titles: Sources: Carlisle agrees to extension with Pacers
Pacers, Rick Carlisle agree to contract extension, per report: Indiana locks up coach after NBA Finals run

summary: The Indiana Pacers and head coach Rick Carlisle have agreed to a multiyear contract extension. This agreement comes after Carlisle led the team to the last two Eastern Conference Finals and helped them reach their second NBA Finals in franchise history, as reported by ESPN and NBA insider Marc Stein.

title: Trump Proposes Putin-Zelenskyy Meeting; No Clear Path to Peace Emerges
snippets: Trump says there are plans underway for Putin and Zelenskyy to meet to discuss an end to the war between Russia and Ukraine. And, Trump wants to stop states from voting by mail.
And can Trump convince Putin to meet Zelensky?
President Volodymyr Zelensky emerged upbeat, but repeated that Ukraine will not cede land to Russia. There were few tangible signs of progress toward a peace deal.
titles: Putin and Zelenskyy could meet. And, Trump wants to stop voting by mail

Zelensky Says He’s Ready to Meet Putin After Trump Talks
summary: Former President Trump announced plans for a meeting between Russian President Putin and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to discuss ending the war between their countries. Trump also expressed a desire to halt mail-in voting in the U.S. Despite the announcement, there was little evidence of significant progress toward a peace agreement, and President Zelenskyy maintained that Ukraine would not concede territory to Russia.

title: SoftBank Buys $2B in Intel Stock Amid AI Market Challenges
snippets: SoftBank will pay $23 per share for Intel's common stock, acquiring roughly 2% of the struggling chipmaker.
The U.S. chipmaker has struggled to keep pace in the AI market alongside competitors like Nvidia. Softbank has agreed to buy Intel common stock at $23 per share.
The company’s latest success comes after Trump briefly called for CEO Lip-Bu Tan to resign.
SoftBank will pay $23 per share for Intel common stock.
titles: Intel is getting a $2 billion investment from SoftBank
Japanese tech investment giant SoftBank to invest $2 billion in Intel
Intel Shares Pop 7% As SoftBank Invests $2 Billion And Trump Administration Weighs Stake
SoftBank makes $2B investment in Intel
summary: SoftBank has agreed to purchase $2 billion worth of Intel's common stock at $23 per share, acquiring approximately 2% of the chipmaker. This investment comes as Intel faces challenges in the AI market, particularly against competitors like Nvidia. The announcement of this deal led to an increase in Intel Corp. shares in after-hours trading. This move signifies SoftBank's continued investment in U.S. semiconductor manufacturing and advanced technology sectors.

title: Qatar, US Propose 60-Day Truce; Hamas Agrees, Israeli Coalition Split
snippets: Qatar says it is "almost identical" to a US proposal for a 60-day truce, during which around half of 50 hostages would be released.

Deal would include 60-day halt to violence and exchange of half of living Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners

Hamas officials say they have accepted a proposal for a Gaza ceasefire deal that would include the release of half of the approximately 20 remaining living Israeli hostages a
Some members of Israel’s coalition have ruled out a proposed hostage deal with Hamas, but the prime minister has yet to state his position.
It was unclear whether Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was on board with the terms, which came as Qatar and Egypt were intensifying mediation efforts.
titles: Mediators await Israeli response to new Gaza ceasefire proposal
Hamas says it accepts proposal for Gaza ceasefire and release of hostages
Netanyahu Faces Pressure From Far Right Over New Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Proposal
Hamas Accepts New Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal, Officials Say
summary: Qatar and the US have proposed a 60-day truce involving the release of about half of the 50 hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. Hamas has accepted this proposal, which also includes a halt to violence. However, some Israeli coalition members oppose the deal, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's stance remains unclear. The proposal is part of Qatar and Egypt's intensified mediation efforts.

title: Swedish Church Relocated 5km to Avoid Subsidence in 30-Year City Move Project
snippets: The landmark 113-year-old wooden building is at risk from subsidence and will be moved 5km on giant rolling platforms.
The relocation of the 113-year-old church is part of a 30-year project to move about 3,000 homes in the city.

What has wheels and crawls along at half a kilometer an hour? A church in Sweden, of course! A convoy of remote-controlled flatbed trailers is transporting a 113-year-old church to the new city center of Kiruna.
titles: The epic two-day operation to move an entire church across a Swedish city
Sweden moves entire church across Kiruna city for mine expansion
Sweden moves landmark Kiruna Church to new site
summary: A 113-year-old wooden church in Kiruna, Sweden, is being relocated 5km to a new city center due to subsidence risks. This move involves the use of remote-controlled flatbed trailers and is part of a larger 30-year project aimed at moving approximately 3,000 homes to safeguard the city. The church's relocation, conducted at a speed of half a kilometer an hour, showcases a significant effort to preserve historical architecture amidst environmental challenges.

Canadians who want to repair their own Apple devices can now get parts, tools and manuals from the tech giant, which brought its self-service repair program to the country on Tuesday. The program gives customers free access to manuals and diagnostic software that help troubleshoot issues with iPads,

summary: Apple has launched its self-service repair program in Canada, allowing Canadians to access parts, tools, and manuals for DIY repairs of their devices. The program, which started on Tuesday, also provides free access to diagnostic software and manuals specifically for iPads.

title: Canada's Inflation Drops to 1.7% in July Due to Lower Gas Prices
snippets: Consumer inflation in Canada rose by less than expected in July, according to Statistics Canada, as falling gasoline prices offset price increases elsewhere.

Inflation cooled in July thanks largely to relief at the gas pumps, but Statistics Canada said grocery and shelter costs were accelerating last month. The annual rate of inflation fell to 1.7 per cent in July, the agency said Tuesday, down from 1.9 per cent in June. The reading was a tenth of a perc
titles: Consumer inflation dropped in July to 1.7%, says StatsCan
Inflation rate cools to 1.7% in July thanks to lower gas prices: StatCan
summary: In July, Canada's annual inflation rate decreased to 1.7%, down from 1.9% in June, as reported by Statistics Canada. This decline was attributed to lower gasoline prices, which helped to mitigate rising costs in groceries and shelter. The fall in inflation was slightly less than anticipated, indicating a mixed economic scenario where decreases in some areas balance out increases in others.

title: Health Canada Approves Ozempic for Kidney Protection in Type 2 Diabetes
snippets: The patients taking the drug were also less likely to die from cardiovascular disease — another condition that affects many patients with diabetes.

Health Canada has approved Ozempic to reduce the risk of further kidney decline among patients with Type 2 diabetes. Between 30 and 50 per cent of people with Type 2 diabetes develop some form of chronic kidney disease. An international clinical trial, called FLOW, showed the risk of kidneys signifi
titles: Ozempic approved in Canada to reduce kidney decline in people with diabetes
Health Canada approves Ozempic to reduce kidney deterioration in people with diabetes
summary: Health Canada has approved the drug Ozempic for reducing the risk of kidney decline in Type 2 diabetes patients, a group where 30-50% develop chronic kidney disease. This decision follows the international FLOW clinical trial, which demonstrated significant kidney risk reduction. Additionally, patients on Ozempic showed a lower likelihood of dying from cardiovascular disease, a common comorbidity in diabetes patients.

title: Nvidia Strikes Deal with U.S. to Sell AI Chips in China, Offers Govt 15% Share
snippets: Nvidia last week struck a deal with the U.S. government to resume selling products in China, in exchange for giving it a 15% cut of the sales.

Nvidia is apparently putting together a new AI chip meant for sale in China that's half as powerful as its flagship B300 Blackwell GPU. The new chip would be more powerful than the H20 GPUs the company is currently allowed to sell in the country.
titles: Nvidia says it's evaluating a 'variety of products' after report of new AI chip for China
Nvidia said to be developing new, more powerful AI chip for sale in China
summary: Nvidia has reached an agreement with the U.S. government to continue its sales in China, offering the government a 15% share of these sales. As part of this deal, Nvidia is developing a new AI chip for the Chinese market, which will be half as powerful as its leading B300 Blackwell GPU but still surpasses the capabilities of the H20 GPUs currently permitted for sale in China.

This incident highlights the personal challenges he has encountered amidst his professional success.

title: Maize Plants Emit Gas to Communicate and Boost Defense in Crowds
snippets: When maize fields become too crowded, the plants signal each other to boost their defenses. A research team led by Dongsheng Guo of Zhejiang University found that in crowded conditions, maize plants release a volatile gas called linalool into the air. When it reaches neighboring plants, the gas trig
titles: Maize plants use a volatile gas to fight off pests in densely crowded fields
summary: A study by Dongsheng Guo and his team at Zhejiang University discovered that maize plants emit a volatile gas, linalool, under crowded conditions to enhance their collective defenses. This gas, when detected by neighboring plants, triggers a defensive response, demonstrating a form of communication among maize to adapt to dense planting environments.

title: Nature's Aspirin: Willow Bark's Role in Medicine Development
snippets: You may not be aware that most of the medicines that have been approved for treatment are rooted in nature. titles: Synthesis of a molecule found in guava plants offers hope in fighting liver-related cancers
summary: Many approved medicines are derived from natural sources. Willow tree bark, known as nature's aspirin, contains salicin converted by the body into salicylic acid, relieving pain. This highlights the importance of nature in developing effective treatments.

title: Study: Only Humpbacks Can Perform High-Performance Bubble-Net Feeding Turns

The research, led by recent University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa graduate Cameron Nemeth, shows humpb
titles: Only the humpback whale is capable of bubble-net feeding, study finds
summary: A new study led by Cameron Nemeth, a University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa graduate, found that among seven species of baleen whales, only humpbacks can perform the high-performance turns needed for bubble-net feeding. This discovery highlights the unique physical capabilities of humpback whales compared to other baleen whales.

title: Farming Waste Adds to Climate Change, Study Finds
snippets: Farming produces a huge amount of crop waste, including straw, husks, and stalks every growing season. Unfortunately, common disposal methods—burning, plowing the waste back into the fields, using it as animal feed, and even composting—release greenhouse gases (GHG) such as methane (CH4), nitrous ox
titles: Long-term biochar can sustainably boost crop yields and cut greenhouse gas emissions
summary: Farming generates significant crop waste annually, with disposal methods like burning, plowing back into fields, using as animal feed, or composting, all releasing greenhouse gases including methane and nitrous oxide. These practices contribute to environmental pollution and climate change.

title: NASA, Aloft Sensing Develop Compact Radar for High-Altitude Earth Observation
snippets: A collaboration between NASA and the small business Aloft Sensing produced a new compact radar system that will enable researchers to leverage High Altitude Long Endurance (HALE) platforms to observe dynamic Earth systems. This new radar is small, provides highly sensitive measurements, and doesn’t
titles: NASA-funded Compact Radar Drives Big Changes in Airborne and Suborbital Radar Capabilities
summary: NASA and Aloft Sensing have developed a compact radar system designed for High Altitude Long Endurance (HALE) platforms, aimed at observing Earth's dynamic systems. This innovative radar offers high sensitivity measurements while maintaining a small size, enhancing the capabilities of researchers to monitor environmental changes from high altitudes.
